TITLE: Former oil CEO blasts FTC over collusion allegations
SUMMARY: The FTC's case "is built on a false narrative," former Pioneer Natural Resources CEO Scott Sheffield said.

TITLE: Big Oil and the Chamber plan to defend Biden’s climate law from Trump
SUMMARY: The U.S. Chamber of Commerce and the American Petroleum Institute have said they'd go to bat for the Inflation Reduction Act. Or at least the provisions they like.

TITLE: ‘Just brutal’: Why America’s hottest city is seeing a surge in deaths
SUMMARY: Climbing temperatures are colliding with a lack of planning in Phoenix. Hundreds have died.

TITLE: Norfolk Southern to pay over $500M for cleanup, rail safety after East Palestine derailment
SUMMARY: The settlement also mandates rail safety upgrades.

TITLE: Democratic senators probe oil execs about Trump's $1B campaign request
SUMMARY: The investigation marks the Democrats' latest salvo against the oil industry just as executives have increased their contributions to the former president's run against Joe Biden.

TITLE: Trump’s EPA chief thinks Biden’s climate rules are doomed. But will Biden’s dollars survive?
SUMMARY: Andrew Wheeler also doesn't rule out returning for Trump 2.0: "Whenever a president or a governor asks you to do something for your country, you step up and you do it."

TITLE: Tesla loses top public policy staffers amid challenging times for the carmaker
SUMMARY: The company has spent more than $2.7 million lobbying the federal government since the start of 2021.

TITLE: Coal dust concerns mount after Baltimore bridge collapse
SUMMARY: The collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge blocked a critical shipping lane, leaving the small town of Curtis Bay with an open-air coal mound that's piling up. Residents worry how the stockpile may affect air quality.

TITLE: Key Bridge collapse fuels coal dust concerns in Baltimore
Trump pressed oil executives to give $1 billion for his campaign, people in industry say
SUMMARY: "This is a scandal" and "an indictment of the system" — but probably legal, one legal watchdog told POLITICO.

TITLE: ‘A little bold and gross’: Oil industry writes executive orders for Trump to sign
SUMMARY: The effort stems from the industry’s skepticism that the Trump campaign will be able to focus on energy issues as election day draws closer.

TITLE: 4 takeaways on Biden’s massive spending plans
SUMMARY: POLITICO’s examination of the administration’s $1.6T energy and infrastructure programs shows a massive set of initiatives struggling to make headway before the clock may run out on Joe Biden’s presidency.

TITLE: Poll: Biden touts his 4 major infrastructure and clean energy laws. Voters doubt they’re working.
SUMMARY: Even when they do see positive benefits, many voters aren’t giving the credit to Biden, a new POLITICO poll shows.

TITLE: ‘Everything’s on fire’: Inside the nation’s failure to safeguard toxic pipelines
SUMMARY: Biden’s and Trump’s energy plans each depend on building new pipelines, but landowners don’t believe the current inspection system can protect them from spills and deadly emissions. They have a point.

TITLE: Biden’s final EV tax credit rules please automakers, anger China hawks
SUMMARY: The rules leave only around 20 percent of EV models eligible for the federal incentive.

TITLE: FTC says Texas oil exec sought to work with OPEC to boost prices
SUMMARY: The stipulation to the takeover lays out the efforts by Pioneer's CEO to coordinate oil output with countries including Saudi Arabia and Russia.

TITLE: Appeals court orders youth climate suit dismissed — again
SUMMARY: The case had long been a potential bright spot for such youth-led climate litigation that has usually failed to take off.

TITLE: FTC to approve major Exxon deal — but exclude key executive over OPEC contacts
SUMMARY: Exxon’s $64 billion takeover of Pioneer Resources is one of a half-dozen Permian Basin mergers under review at the agency.

TITLE: Test drive of Kodiak Robotics self-driving tractor-trailer
Coal’s future dims as new regulations pile on and former defenders retreat
SUMMARY: The industry's most influential bipartisan backers are leaving, but others will take their place — at least among the GOP.

TITLE: Biden’s latest aggressive climate rule launched today. Will it satisfy unhappy green voters?
SUMMARY: The EPA regulation comes amid the president’s continued struggles to assuage unhappiness among young, climate-minded voters.

TITLE: US solar manufacturers target China-linked imports in new plea to Biden
SUMMARY: Domestic manufacturers continue to struggle in the face of competition from cheaper imports from Asia, prompting these companies to fight back in a series of trade petitions.

TITLE: Robert Kennedy Jr. pivots right on climate change — but sharpens his threat to Biden
SUMMARY: The scion of the Kennedy political dynasty is drawing attacks from both Democrats and Republicans — and from his former environmental allies, who call him "no different than Donald Trump."

TITLE: Green groups call on voters to oppose RFK Jr.
SUMMARY: Kennedy's entry into the presidential race amplified the friction with the environmental movement.

TITLE: Biden moves to limit oil drilling and mineral mining in Alaska, in latest win for greens
SUMMARY: The moves also shore up support from tribes and conservation groups, but face criticism from Alaska lawmakers.

TITLE: Biden set to block Ambler mining road in Alaska wilderness
SUMMARY: The move to preserve the preserve the pristine wilderness has been sought by Alaskan tribes, but would keep the critical minerals in the region from being mined.

TITLE: Senate approves resolution targeting Biden highway climate rule, with Democratic support
SUMMARY: The Senate on Wednesday passed a measure to nullify a Transportation Department rule targeting highway greenhouse gas emissions.

TITLE: Biden rule targets toxic chemicals in US drinking water
SUMMARY: The regulation is a major win for advocates from communities with contaminated drinking water who have sought an enforceable limit on the chemicals for years.

TITLE: ‘It would just die on the vine’: Biden’s $200 billion energy loan juggernaut faces a Trump-sized threat
SUMMARY: The Energy Department loan program that bankrolled Solyndra and Tesla has gotten a huge infusion under President Joe Biden. And it’s facing an uncertain future if Donald Trump wins.

TITLE: What happens to solar power when the moon blocks the sun?
SUMMARY: U.S. power system operators are planning for a drop in solar generation Monday as darkness covers a swath of the United States.
